newsArray.title: Two weeks later, no coaching vacancy has been filled
creator: Mike Florio
newsArray.description: Three coaches were fired during the season. Two joined them on Monday, January 9. In 15 days since then, no one has made a hire. Weâ€™ve seen how it happens in the past. Once the first domino falls, others follow. For now, the process generally is shifting from a broad wave of first interviews to [more]
newsArray.content: Three coaches were fired during the season. Two joined them on Monday, January 9. In 15 days since then, no one has made a hire. Weâ€™ve seen how it happens in the past. Once the first domino falls, others follow. For now, the process generally is shifting from a broad wave of first interviews to a more narrow set of second interviews. Then, decisions will be made. Some ultimately may wait to make a hire until after the Super Bowl, like the Vikings did a year ago with Rams offensive coordinator Kevin Oâ€™Connell. If someone wants 49ers defensive coordinator DeMeco Ryans, Eagles defensive coordinator Jonathan Gannon, or Chiefs offensive coordinator Eric Bieniemy, that could be the case. The biggest name in the current cycle, of course, is available to be hired at any time. And four of the five teams (Broncos, Texans, Cardinals, Panthers) have interviewed or will interview Sean Payton. Itâ€™s unknown what Payton wants. He could choose to go to the Broncos, a team that has a great fan base, a strong tradition of winning, ownership with chasm-deep pockets, and a quarterback situation that wonâ€™t be blamed on Payton if he canâ€™t rectify things in 2023. Which basically gives him a redshirt year. Payton could end up with the Panthers, if he prefers a clean slate at quarterback â€” and if owner David Tepper is willing to dig deep financially and to give the Saints the enhanced package theyâ€™ll want for Paytonâ€™s rights. One real attraction in Charlotte comes from the fact that, while the AFC West is one of the best divisions in football, the NFC South currently is not. Payton also could land in Houston. Thatâ€™s the closest approximation to New Orleans. A team with very limited success in 20 years of NFL football. Payton could become the same kind of hero there that he is in New Orleans. Arizona seems like a longer shot, given that theyâ€™ve already hired a G.M. And thereâ€™s a lingering vibe that Brian Flores is the favorite there, especially since new General Manager Monti Ossenfort (like Flores) has Patriot Way DNA. The presence of entrenched General Managers in Denver, Charlotte, and Houston also becomes a factor. They naturally wonâ€™t want to have their status diminished, and potentially their employment jeopardized, if Payton shows up and takes over. That could give the likes of George Paton, Scott Fitterer, and Nick Caserio, respectively, an interest in trying to nudge the process away from Payton. Still, Payton is the key. Once he lands with a team, the others likely will begin to fall into place. Along the way, someone may decide to take a look at Bengals defensive coordinator Lou Anarumo, who continues to do an excellent job against some of the better offenses in the NFL. If the Bengals can neutralize Patrick Mahomes , Andy Reid, and company on Sunday at Arrowhead Stadium, maybe one of these five teams should wait until the day after the Super Bowl to bring Anarumo in for an interview.

newsArray.title: Kelleher earns Colchester a point
newsArray.description: Fiacre Kelleher came off the bench to earn Colchester a point from their 1-1 draw with promotion-chasing Salford in Sky Bet League Two.
newsArray.content: Fiacre Kelleher came off the bench to earn Colchester a point from their 1-1 draw with promotion-chasing Salford in Sky Bet League Two. The Ammies went close in the 10th minute when home goalkeeper Kieran O'Hara pushed away Matt Smith's header, following Jason Lowe's ball into the area. The visitors edged the first half but Colchester almost took the lead in first-half stoppage-time when John Akinde sent a free header straight at keeper Alex Cairns, following Noah Chilvers' ball into the six-yard box. The second half was a livelier affair and Salford took a 49th-minute lead through Conor McAleny, who nodded in from close range from Ryan Watson's assist after Theo Vassell's header from a corner had struck the crossbar. However, Colchester equalised in the 63rd minute when substitute Kelleher rose to plant a fine header from Luke Chambers' pass into the net. Arthur Read's long-range effort was pushed away by Cairns, who also brilliantly pushed away Cole Skuse's rocket for a corner in the closing stages. League Two table League Two fixtures League Two news Get Sky Sports However, the points were shared. Make yourself a millionaire with Super 6. Play for free, entries by 3pm Boxing Day.

newsArray.title: Everton owner Moshiri puts club up for SALE for Â£500m amid fan protests as â€˜number of buyersâ€™ eye managerless Toffees
creator: Dylan Terry
newsArray.content: Everton owner Farhad Moshiri has reportedly put the club up for sale. The Toffees sacked manager Frank Lampard on Monday after a dreadful run of results has left them fighting relegation for a second successive season. PAEverton owner Farhad Moshiri has put the club up for sale after fan protests[/caption] PAEverton supporters have been calling for new ownership[/caption] Everton supporters have led numerous protests against the current ownership, calling for them to leave. According to The Guardian, Moshiri is now seeking an exit strategy after seven years in charge he looks to sell the club for more than Â£500million. The British-Iranian businessman had been looking for outside investment, but is now open to a wholesale takeover. He is willing to accept a minority or majority sale, with a â€œnumber of potential buyersâ€ having already expressed an interest. Deloitte are reportedly set to oversee the sale of the club. Moshiri has put money up for Evertonâ€™s new stadium which is currently being built at Bramley-Moore Dock. And he is wanting to recoup that money as he plans to vacate Merseyside. The new ground is set to cost the club at least Â£550. BETTING SPECIAL â€“ BEST FOOTBALL BETTING SITES IN THE UK Moshiriâ€™s ownership have spent around Â£700m on players but seen little success on the pitch. They have seen a host of managers come and go including Ronald Koeman, Sam Allardyce, Marco Silva, Carlo Ancelotti, Rafa Benitez and now Lampard. Former Leeds boss Marcelo Bielsa is the favourite to take over the Toffees as they bid to climb out of the relegation zone. More to follow.

newsArray.title: Real Madrid want Jude Bellingham in sensational swap transfer as they â€˜prepare offer of Â£88m AND Eduardo Camavingaâ€™
creator: Anthony Chapman
newsArray.content: REAL MADRID are reportedly desperate to sign Jude Bellingham ahead of Premier League rivals. And they are ready to offer Â£88million AND Eduardo Camavinga in exchange for the Borussia Dortmund star this summer. Real Madrid are set to bid Â£88m for Borussia Dortmund star Jude BellinghamGetty Real are also ready to offer Eduardo Camavinga as part of their bidRex Sky Germany claims Real chiefs are ready to make an offer their German counterparts canâ€™t refuse as the race for Bellingham heats up. The England ace, 19, is one of Europeâ€™s most sought-after players after an outstanding World Cup campaign. And Bellingham is being chased by almost all of the Premier Leagueâ€™s top sides to spark a major summer transfer scramble. However, Real believe they can land the teen as long as they can persuade Dortmund into accepting an offer. The Spanish champs canâ€™t afford the reported Â£135m price-tag, having already committed to a Â£60m deal for 16-year-old Brazilian winger Endrick. So Real are instead plotting to bid a tasty Â£88m fee while also handing over Camavinga in exchange. Like Bellingham, the 20-year-old France international is rated as one of the continentâ€™s top young midfielders. However, it appears Real see Bellingham as the better long-term prospect for their ambitions. HOW TO GET FREE BETS ON FOOTBALL And they are reportedly ready to sacrifice Camavinga to get a deal over the line. The tempting swap-plus-cash proposal could be enough to twist Dortmundâ€™s arm. It would firstly provide the Bundesliga side with an immediate like-for-like replacement. And they would also have a stunning amount of money to significantly strengthen several other areas of their squad. Most importantly, Camavinga is apparently open to the idea as well after struggling for minutes at Real this season. And on the other side of the deal, it would take a lot to dissuade Bellingham from linking up with fellow young icons like Vinicius Jr and Aurelien Tchouameni.

newsArray.title: Southampton 0-0 Newcastle LIVE: Carabao Cup semi-final clash underway as in-form Magpies and struggling Saints aim to boost chances of reaching Wembley
creator: Jack Johnson
newsArray.content: Newcastle travel to the south coast tonight to face Southampton with dreams of making it to Wembley. The Magpies havenâ€™t been in a domestic cup final since the 1998/99 campaign, but playing the Saints over a two-legged Carabao Cup semi-final looks like a brilliant chance to end that run. The Toon have the best defensive record in the top-flight and Nick Pope hasnâ€™t conceded a goal in his last nine games. Meanwhile, Southampton appear to have hit a bit of form under Nathan Jones and have won three of their last four as they look to return to Wembley. The Saints reached the 2016/17 Carabao Cup final but were beaten 3-2 by Manchester United. Carabao Cup semi-final first leg to kick-off at 8pm. Southampton XI: Bazunu, Walker-Peters, Lyanco, Caleta-Car, Salisu, Diallo, Alcaraz, Ward-Prowse, Djenepo, Orsic, Mara.Subs: Caballero, Bednarek, Perraud, Lavia, Maitland-Niles, Edozie, Elyounoussi, Armstrong, Adams.Newcastle XI: Pope, Trippier, Schar, Botman, Burn, Guimaraes, Longstaff, Willock, Almiron, Joelinton, Wilson.Subs: Darlow, Lascelles, Saint-Maximin, Ritchie, Lewis, Isak, Manquillo, Murphy, Anderson.talkSPORT will have live coverage from the south coast.Commentary will come from Jim Proudfoot and former West Ham forward Dean Ashton. Follow our live match blog below for regular updatesâ€¦

Some ultimately may wait to make a hire until after the Super Bowl, like the Vikings did a year ago with Rams offensive coordinator Kevin Oâ€™Connell. If someone wants 49ers defensive coordinator DeMeco Ryans, Eagles defensive coordinator Jonathan Gannon, or Chiefs offensive coordinator Eric Bieniemy, that could be the case. The biggest name in the current cycle, of course, is available to be hired at any time. And four of the five teams (Broncos, Texans, Cardinals, Panthers) have interviewed or will interview Sean Payton. Itâ€™s unknown what Payton wants. He could choose to go to the Broncos, a team that has a great fan base, a strong tradition of winning, ownership with chasm-deep pockets, and a quarterback situation that wonâ€™t be blamed on Payton if he canâ€™t rectify things in 2023. Which basically gives him a redshirt year. Payton could end up with the Panthers, if he prefers a clean slate at quarterback â€” and if owner David Tepper is willing to dig deep financially and to give the Saints the enhanced package theyâ€™ll want for Paytonâ€™s rights. One real attraction in Charlotte comes from the fact that, while the AFC West is one of the best divisions in football, the NFC South currently is not. Payton also could land in Houston. Thatâ€™s the closest approximation to New Orleans. A team with very limited success in 20 years of NFL football. Payton could become the same kind of hero there that he is in New Orleans. Arizona seems like a longer shot, given that theyâ€™ve already hired a G.M. And thereâ€™s a lingering vibe that Brian Flores is the favorite there, especially since new General Manager Monti Ossenfort (like Flores) has Patriot Way DNA. The presence of entrenched General Managers in Denver, Charlotte, and Houston also becomes a factor. They naturally wonâ€™t want to have their status diminished, and potentially their employment jeopardized, if Payton shows up and takes over. That could give the likes of George Paton, Scott Fitterer, and Nick Caserio, respectively, an interest in trying to nudge the process away from Payton. Still, Payton is the key. Once he lands with a team, the others likely will begin to fall into place. Along the way, someone may decide to take a look at Bengals defensive coordinator Lou Anarumo, who continues to do an excellent job against some of the better offenses in the NFL. If the Bengals can neutralize Patrick Mahomes , Andy Reid, and company on Sunday at Arrowhead Stadium, maybe one of these five teams should wait until the day after the Super Bowl to bring Anarumo in for an interview.

newsArray.title: Kelleher earns Colchester a point
newsArray.description: Fiacre Kelleher came off the bench to earn Colchester a point from their 1-1 draw with promotion-chasing Salford in Sky Bet League Two.
newsArray.content: Fiacre Kelleher came off the bench to earn Colchester a point from their 1-1 draw with promotion-chasing Salford in Sky Bet League Two. The Ammies went close in the 10th minute when home goalkeeper Kieran O'Hara pushed away Matt Smith's header, following Jason Lowe's ball into the area. The visitors edged the first half but Colchester almost took the lead in first-half stoppage-time when John Akinde sent a free header straight at keeper Alex Cairns, following Noah Chilvers' ball into the six-yard box. The second half was a livelier affair and Salford took a 49th-minute lead through Conor McAleny, who nodded in from close range from Ryan Watson's assist after Theo Vassell's header from a corner had struck the crossbar. However, Colchester equalised in the 63rd minute when substitute Kelleher rose to plant a fine header from Luke Chambers' pass into the net. Arthur Read's long-range effort was pushed away by Cairns, who also brilliantly pushed away Cole Skuse's rocket for a corner in the closing stages. newsArray.title: Everton owner Moshiri puts club up for SALE for Â£500m amid fan protests as â€˜number of buyersâ€™ eye managerless Toffees
creator: Dylan Terry
newsArray.content: Everton owner Farhad Moshiri has reportedly put the club up for sale. The Toffees sacked manager Frank Lampard on Monday after a dreadful run of results has left them fighting relegation for a second successive season. PAEverton owner Farhad Moshiri has put the club up for sale after fan protests[/caption] PAEverton supporters have been calling for new ownership[/caption] Everton supporters have led numerous protests against the current ownership, calling for them to leave. According to The Guardian, Moshiri is now seeking an exit strategy after seven years in charge he looks to sell the club for more than Â£500million. The British-Iranian businessman had been looking for outside investment, but is now open to a wholesale takeover. He is willing to accept a minority or majority sale, with a â€œnumber of potential buyersâ€ having already expressed an interest. Deloitte are reportedly set to oversee the sale of the club. Moshiri has put money up for Evertonâ€™s new stadium which is currently being built at Bramley-Moore Dock. And he is wanting to recoup that money as he plans to vacate Merseyside. The new ground is set to cost the club at least Â£550. BETTING SPECIAL â€“ BEST FOOTBALL BETTING SITES IN THE UK Moshiriâ€™s ownership have spent around Â£700m on players but seen little success on the pitch. They have seen a host of managers come and go including Ronald Koeman, Sam Allardyce, Marco Silva, Carlo Ancelotti, Rafa Benitez and now Lampard. Former Leeds boss Marcelo Bielsa is the favourite to take over the Toffees as they bid to climb out of the relegation zone. More to follow.

newsArray.title: Real Madrid want Jude Bellingham in sensational swap transfer as they â€˜prepare offer of Â£88m AND Eduardo Camavingaâ€™
creator: Anthony Chapman
newsArray.content: REAL MADRID are reportedly desperate to sign Jude Bellingham ahead of Premier League rivals. And they are ready to offer Â£88million AND Eduardo Camavinga in exchange for the Borussia Dortmund star this summer. Real Madrid are set to bid Â£88m for Borussia Dortmund star Jude BellinghamGetty Real are also ready to offer Eduardo Camavinga as part of their bidRex Sky Germany claims Real chiefs are ready to make an offer their German counterparts canâ€™t refuse as the race for Bellingham heats up. The England ace, 19, is one of Europeâ€™s most sought-after players after an outstanding World Cup campaign. And Bellingham is being chased by almost all of the Premier Leagueâ€™s top sides to spark a major summer transfer scramble. However, Real believe they can land the teen as long as they can persuade Dortmund into accepting an offer. The Spanish champs canâ€™t afford the reported Â£135m price-tag, having already committed to a Â£60m deal for 16-year-old Brazilian winger Endrick. So Real are instead plotting to bid a tasty Â£88m fee while also handing over Camavinga in exchange. Like Bellingham, the 20-year-old France international is rated as one of the continentâ€™s top young midfielders. However, it appears Real see Bellingham as the better long-term prospect for their ambitions. HOW TO GET FREE BETS ON FOOTBALL And they are reportedly ready to sacrifice Camavinga to get a deal over the line. The tempting swap-plus-cash proposal could be enough to twist Dortmundâ€™s arm. It would firstly provide the Bundesliga side with an immediate like-for-like replacement. And they would also have a stunning amount of money to significantly strengthen several other areas of their squad. Most importantly, Camavinga is apparently open to the idea as well after struggling for minutes at Real this season. And on the other side of the deal, it would take a lot to dissuade Bellingham from linking up with fellow young icons like Vinicius Jr and Aurelien Tchouameni.

newsArray.title: Southampton 0-0 Newcastle LIVE: Carabao Cup semi-final clash underway as in-form Magpies and struggling Saints aim to boost chances of reaching Wembley
creator: Jack Johnson
newsArray.content: Newcastle travel to the south coast tonight to face Southampton with dreams of making it to Wembley. The Magpies havenâ€™t been in a domestic cup final since the 1998/99 campaign, but playing the Saints over a two-legged Carabao Cup semi-final looks like a brilliant chance to end that run. The Toon have the best defensive record in the top-flight and Nick Pope hasnâ€™t conceded a goal in his last nine games. Meanwhile, Southampton appear to have hit a bit of form under Nathan Jones and have won three of their last four as they look to return to Wembley. The Saints reached the 2016/17 Carabao Cup final but were beaten 3-2 by Manchester United. Carabao Cup semi-final first leg to kick-off at 8pm. Southampton XI: Bazunu, Walker-Peters, Lyanco, Caleta-Car, Salisu, Diallo, Alcaraz, Ward-Prowse, Djenepo, Orsic, Mara.Subs: Caballero, Bednarek, Perraud, Lavia, Maitland-Niles, Edozie, Elyounoussi, Armstrong, Adams.Newcastle XI: Pope, Trippier, Schar, Botman, Burn, Guimaraes, Longstaff, Willock, Almiron, Joelinton, Wilson.Subs: Darlow, Lascelles, Saint-Maximin, Ritchie, Lewis, Isak, Manquillo, Murphy, Anderson.talkSPORT will have live coverage from the south coast.Commentary will come from Jim Proudfoot and former West Ham forward Dean Ashton. The second half was a livelier affair and Salford took a 49th-minute lead through Conor McAleny, who nodded in from close range from Ryan Watson's assist after Theo Vassell's header from a corner had struck the crossbar. However, Colchester equalised in the 63rd minute when substitute Kelleher rose to plant a fine header from Luke Chambers' pass into the net. Arthur Read's long-range effort was pushed away by Cairns, who also brilliantly pushed away Cole Skuse's rocket for a corner in the closing stages. newsArray.title: Everton owner Moshiri puts club up for SALE for Â£500m amid fan protests as â€˜number of buyersâ€™ eye managerless Toffees
creator: Dylan Terry
newsArray.content: Everton owner Farhad Moshiri has reportedly put the club up for sale. The Toffees sacked manager Frank Lampard on Monday after a dreadful run of results has left them fighting relegation for a second successive season. PAEverton owner Farhad Moshiri has put the club up for sale after fan protests[/caption] PAEverton supporters have been calling for new ownership[/caption] Everton supporters have led numerous protests against the current ownership, calling for them to leave. According to The Guardian, Moshiri is now seeking an exit strategy after seven years in charge he looks to sell the club for more than Â£500million. The British-Iranian businessman had been looking for outside investment, but is now open to a wholesale takeover. He is willing to accept a minority or majority sale, with a â€œnumber of potential buyersâ€ having already expressed an interest. Deloitte are reportedly set to oversee the sale of the club. Moshiri has put money up for Evertonâ€™s new stadium which is currently being built at Bramley-Moore Dock. And he is wanting to recoup that money as he plans to vacate Merseyside. The new ground is set to cost the club at least Â£550. BETTING SPECIAL â€“ BEST FOOTBALL BETTING SITES IN THE UK Moshiriâ€™s ownership have spent around Â£700m on players but seen little success on the pitch. They have seen a host of managers come and go including Ronald Koeman, Sam Allardyce, Marco Silva, Carlo Ancelotti, Rafa Benitez and now Lampard. Former Leeds boss Marcelo Bielsa is the favourite to take over the Toffees as they bid to climb out of the relegation zone. More to follow.

newsArray.title: Real Madrid want Jude Bellingham in sensational swap transfer as they â€˜prepare offer of Â£88m AND Eduardo Camavingaâ€™
creator: Anthony Chapman
newsArray.content: REAL MADRID are reportedly desperate to sign Jude Bellingham ahead of Premier League rivals. And they are ready to offer Â£88million AND Eduardo Camavinga in exchange for the Borussia Dortmund star this summer. Real Madrid are set to bid Â£88m for Borussia Dortmund star Jude BellinghamGetty Real are also ready to offer Eduardo Camavinga as part of their bidRex Sky Germany claims Real chiefs are ready to make an offer their German counterparts canâ€™t refuse as the race for Bellingham heats up. The England ace, 19, is one of Europeâ€™s most sought-after players after an outstanding World Cup campaign. And Bellingham is being chased by almost all of the Premier Leagueâ€™s top sides to spark a major summer transfer scramble. However, Real believe they can land the teen as long as they can persuade Dortmund into accepting an offer. The Spanish champs canâ€™t afford the reported Â£135m price-tag, having already committed to a Â£60m deal for 16-year-old Brazilian winger Endrick. So Real are instead plotting to bid a tasty Â£88m fee while also handing over Camavinga in exchange. Like Bellingham, the 20-year-old France international is rated as one of the continentâ€™s top young midfielders. However, it appears Real see Bellingham as the better long-term prospect for their ambitions. HOW TO GET FREE BETS ON FOOTBALL And they are reportedly ready to sacrifice Camavinga to get a deal over the line. The tempting swap-plus-cash proposal could be enough to twist Dortmundâ€™s arm. It would firstly provide the Bundesliga side with an immediate like-for-like replacement. And they would also have a stunning amount of money to significantly strengthen several other areas of their squad. Most importantly, Camavinga is apparently open to the idea as well after struggling for minutes at Real this season. And on the other side of the deal, it would take a lot to dissuade Bellingham from linking up with fellow young icons like Vinicius Jr and Aurelien Tchouameni.

newsArray.title: Southampton 0-0 Newcastle LIVE: Carabao Cup semi-final clash underway as in-form Magpies and struggling Saints aim to boost chances of reaching Wembley
creator: Jack Johnson
newsArray.content: Newcastle travel to the south coast tonight to face Southampton with dreams of making it to Wembley. The Magpies havenâ€™t been in a domestic cup final since the 1998/99 campaign, but playing the Saints over a two-legged Carabao Cup semi-final looks like a brilliant chance to end that run. The Toon have the best defensive record in the top-flight and Nick Pope hasnâ€™t conceded a goal in his last nine games. Meanwhile, Southampton appear to have hit a bit of form under Nathan Jones and have won three of their last four as they look to return to Wembley. The Saints reached the 2016/17 Carabao Cup final but were beaten 3-2 by Manchester United. Carabao Cup semi-final first leg to kick-off at 8pm. Southampton XI: Bazunu, Walker-Peters, Lyanco, Caleta-Car, Salisu, Diallo, Alcaraz, Ward-Prowse, Djenepo, Orsic, Mara.Subs: Caballero, Bednarek, Perraud, Lavia, Maitland-Niles, Edozie, Elyounoussi, Armstrong, Adams.Newcastle XI: Pope, Trippier, Schar, Botman, Burn, Guimaraes, Longstaff, Willock, Almiron, Joelinton, Wilson.Subs: Darlow, Lascelles, Saint-Maximin, Ritchie, Lewis, Isak, Manquillo, Murphy, Anderson.talkSPORT will have live coverage from the south coast.Commentary will come from Jim Proudfoot and former West Ham forward Dean Ashton.
